metadata.title: AI Orchestration Navigation Index - Multi-Agent Systems Guide

section.technical-explanation: AI Orchestration domain navigation provides systematic access to multi-agent system concepts, cost optimization strategies, and practical implementation guidance. The domain covers agent coordination patterns, cost management techniques, and production-ready workflow design.
section.simple-explanation: This is your guide to learning how to coordinate multiple AI agents to work together effectively and affordably. Think of it as a roadmap through all the concepts and practical steps you need to master AI orchestration.

instructions.step: Start with agent orchestration basics to understand core concepts
Learn cost optimization to keep projects affordable
Apply concepts in practice with guided exercises

link.title: Agent Orchestration Basics
link.description: Core concepts of multi-agent coordination and workflow design

link.title: Cost Optimization Strategies
link.description: Budget management and efficiency techniques for AI systems

section.technical-explanation: Structured learning progression through AI orchestration concepts with clear dependencies and skill building pathways. Each path is designed for specific learning objectives and skill levels.
section.simple-explanation: Step-by-step paths through the content based on what you want to learn and your current skill level.

link.title: Foundation Learning Path (WALK Phase)
link.description: Start here: Core concepts → Practice activities → Claude Code integration

link.title: Implementation Path (CRAWL Phase)
link.description: Cost strategies → ElevenLabs integration → Production checklist

link.title: Production Path (RUN Phase)
link.description: Advanced orchestration → Subagents → Full production workflow

section.technical-explanation: Task-oriented navigation paths for specific objectives including concept learning, cost management, and production implementation. Each path provides direct routes to relevant materials based on current needs.
section.simple-explanation: Quick paths to find exactly what you need for your current task or problem.

section.technical-explanation: Learning phase progression aligned with WALK-CRAWL-RUN methodology, providing clear advancement paths from conceptual understanding through practical implementation to full production deployment.
section.simple-explanation: Your learning journey organized by phases: free learning, first implementation, and full production.

link.description: Basics → No-API activities → Claude Code introduction

link.title: CRAWL Phase (First Implementation)
link.description: Cost optimization → ElevenLabs → Production checklist

link.title: RUN Phase (Full Orchestration)
link.description: Advanced orchestration → Subagents → Full production

section.technical-explanation: Emergency navigation paths for common orchestration problems including agent failures, cost overruns, quality issues, and integration problems. Each path provides direct routes to diagnostic and resolution materials.
section.simple-explanation: Quick help when things go wrong - organized by the type of problem you're having.

link.description: Agent debugging → Troubleshooting → Subagents guide

validation.success-criteria: All emergency navigation targets are accessible
